title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 31 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 31.

questions.question: What did all Israel do after finishing their work according to 2 Chronicles 31:1?
options: Broke images, cut down groves, and threw down high places and altars
Built new altars and groves
Made peace offerings to the neighboring nations
Returned to Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Broke images, cut down groves, and threw down high places and altars
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states that all Israel broke the images, cut down the groves, and threw down the high places and altars.

questions.question: Who did Hezekiah appoint according to their service in 2 Chronicles 31:2?
options: Priests and Levites
Kings and princes
Prophets and scribes
Merchants and soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: Priests and Levites
questions.explanation: Hezekiah appointed the courses of the priests and Levites according to their service as stated in verse 2.

questions.question: What did Hezekiah appoint the king's portion for, according to 2 Chronicles 31:3?
options: Burnt offerings for mornings, evenings, sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts
Building the temple
Feeding the poor
Buying new clothes for the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt offerings for mornings, evenings, sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts
questions.explanation: Verse 3 explains that Hezekiah appointed the king’s portion for burnt offerings at these specified times.

questions.question: What were the people in Jerusalem commanded to give, according to 2 Chronicles 31:4?
options: The portion of the priests and Levites
Gold and silver
Livestock for sacrifices
Grain for the king
questions.correctAnswer: The portion of the priests and Levites
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states the people were commanded to give the portion of the priests and Levites to encourage them in the law of the LORD.

questions.question: What did the children of Israel bring abundantly as soon as the commandment was given (2 Chronicles 31:5)?
options: Firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, honey, and all the increase of the field
Gold and silver
Only sheep and oxen
Weapons and armor
questions.correctAnswer: Firstfruits of corn, wine, oil, honey, and all the increase of the field
questions.explanation: Verse 5 details the abundance of firstfruits and tithes brought by the people in response to the commandment.

questions.question: What kind of tithes did the children of Israel and Judah bring according to 2 Chronicles 31:6?
options: Tithe of oxen, sheep, and holy things consecrated to the LORD
Only grain tithe
Tithe of gold and silver
No tithes were brought
questions.correctAnswer: Tithe of oxen, sheep, and holy things consecrated to the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 6 specifies that they brought the tithe of oxen, sheep, and holy things consecrated to the LORD.

questions.question: When did they begin and finish laying the foundation of the heaps (2 Chronicles 31:7)?
options: Began in the third month and finished in the seventh month
Began in the first month and finished in the twelfth month
Began in the sixth month and finished in the ninth month
Began and finished in the same month
questions.correctAnswer: Began in the third month and finished in the seventh month
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states the foundation of heaps was laid starting in the third month and finished in the seventh month.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah and the princes respond when they saw the heaps (2 Chronicles 31:8)?
options: They blessed the LORD and His people Israel
They were angry and destroyed the heaps
They ignored the heaps
They took the heaps for themselves
questions.correctAnswer: They blessed the LORD and His people Israel
questions.explanation: Verse 8 shows that upon seeing the heaps, Hezekiah and the princes blessed the LORD and His people.

questions.question: According to Azariah the chief priest in 2 Chronicles 31:10, what was the result since the people began bringing offerings?
options: They have had enough to eat and have left plenty
The offerings were insufficient
The offerings were rejected
The priests went hungry
questions.correctAnswer: They have had enough to eat and have left plenty
questions.explanation: Azariah in verse 10 says they had enough food and more left over because the LORD blessed the people.

questions.question: Who was appointed as ruler over the offerings and tithes according to 2 Chronicles 31:12?
options: Cononiah the Levite
Azariah the priest
Hezekiah the king
Jerimoth the overseer
questions.correctAnswer: Cononiah the Levite
questions.explanation: Verse 12 names Cononiah the Levite as ruler over the offerings and tithes.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 31:14, Kore the son of Imnah was the porter toward the west.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 14 states Kore was the porter toward the east, not the west.

questions.question: True or False: The priests and Levites sanctified themselves in holiness through their set office according to 2 Chronicles 31:18.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 18 confirms that in their office, they sanctified themselves in holiness.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah did all his work for the service of the house of God with half his heart according to 2 Chronicles 31:21.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states Hezekiah did all his work with all his heart.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Chronicles 31:20: 'And thus did Hezekiah throughout all Judah, and wrought that which was good and ______ and truth before the LORD his God.'
options: right
evil
false
wicked
questions.correctAnswer: right
questions.explanation: Verse 20 says Hezekiah wrought that which was good and right and truth before the LORD.

questions.question: Who were the overseers under the hand of Cononiah and Shimei according to 2 Chronicles 31:13?
options: Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath, and Benaiah
Hezekiah and Azariah
Kore and Eden
The sons of Aaron only
questions.correctAnswer: Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath, and Benaiah
questions.explanation: Verse 13 lists these men as overseers under Cononiah and Shimei.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 31 teach us about the importance of obedience and destroying idols?
options: By breaking images, cutting down groves, and throwing down altars throughout Judah
By building new altars for the idols
By ignoring the high places and focusing on personal prayer
By offering sacrifices to foreign gods
questions.correctAnswer: By breaking images, cutting down groves, and throwing down altars throughout Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:1 shows that all Israel obeyed God's command by destroying idols and altars, demonstrating faithfulness and obedience to God's Word. This teaches practical Christian living through rejecting false worship and wholeheartedly serving the true God.

questions.question: What does Hezekiah’s appointment of priests and Levites for their service teach about spiritual discipline and church order?
options: Each man was appointed according to his service for offerings and praise
The priests and Levites were left to serve randomly
Only Levites were appointed, not priests
Hezekiah did not organize the service
questions.correctAnswer: Each man was appointed according to his service for offerings and praise
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:2 emphasizes organizing spiritual duties with order and discipline, encouraging believers to serve God faithfully and systematically in church life, promoting integrity and dedication.

questions.question: How does the provision of the king’s portion for burnt offerings emphasize stewardship and generosity?
options: The king provided his own substance for morning, evening, sabbath, new moons, and feasts offerings
The king did not contribute anything
The priests were responsible for their own offerings only
The people gave offerings but the king did not
questions.correctAnswer: The king provided his own substance for morning, evening, sabbath, new moons, and feasts offerings
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:3 shows Hezekiah's personal commitment to stewardship and generosity, setting an example by providing for God’s service according to the law, encouraging all to give faithfully.

questions.question: What biblical principle is taught by commanding the people of Jerusalem to give portions to the priests and Levites?
options: Encouraging support for those who minister the Word of God
Ignoring the needs of the priests and Levites
Forcing people to give under threat
Making the priests work for their own provision
questions.correctAnswer: Encouraging support for those who minister the Word of God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:4 teaches the practical Christian principle of supporting spiritual leaders so they can focus on ministry, fostering generosity and care within the church family.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to trust God’s provision. Based on 2 Chronicles 31, what biblical truth regarding God’s blessing would you share?
options: When the people gave abundantly, God blessed them with plenty left over
God does not care about our giving
Giving leads to scarcity
Blessings come only to the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: When the people gave abundantly, God blessed them with plenty left over
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:5 and 31:10 show that as Israel gave the firstfruits and tithes abundantly, the LORD blessed them with more than enough, teaching trust in God's faithful provision through generosity.

questions.question: How does the laying of heaps of tithes and offerings from the third to the seventh month illustrate perseverance in obedience?
options: It shows consistent and enduring obedience over several months
It was done only once and forgotten
It was done reluctantly without faith
The heaps were quickly removed
questions.correctAnswer: It shows consistent and enduring obedience over several months
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:6-7 describes how the people faithfully brought tithes and offerings over many months, demonstrating perseverance in spiritual discipline and commitment to God’s commands.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah was indifferent to the offerings and did not inquire about them.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hezekiah actively questioned the priests and Levites about the heaps of offerings (2 Chronicles 31:9), showing his concern for faithful stewardship and accountability in service to God.

questions.question: Who gave the answer to Hezekiah about the abundance of offerings and God’s blessing?
options: Azariah the chief priest of the house of Zadok
Hezekiah himself
A Levite named Cononiah
A foreign visitor
questions.correctAnswer: Azariah the chief priest of the house of Zadok
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:10 records Azariah, the chief priest, explaining that since offerings began, they had enough to eat and a great store was left, indicating God's blessing upon the people.

questions.question: What does Hezekiah’s command to prepare chambers for offerings teach about integrity and order in church finance?
options: It shows careful and faithful handling of offerings and tithes
It shows neglect of the offerings
It encourages casual giving without record
It delegates everything without supervision
questions.correctAnswer: It shows careful and faithful handling of offerings and tithes
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:11-12 demonstrates Hezekiah’s commitment to transparency and order in managing resources dedicated to God, encouraging integrity in stewardship.

questions.question: How does the appointment of overseers and rulers among the Levites encourage effective church service?
options: It ensures organized and accountable ministry
It allows chaos in service
It removes responsibility from leaders
It ignores genealogical order
questions.correctAnswer: It ensures organized and accountable ministry
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:12-13 shows that Hezekiah appointed overseers and rulers to manage offerings and service, teaching that order and accountability are vital in church leadership and service.

questions.question: What role did Kore the son of Imnah have in the service of the house of the LORD?
options: He was the porter overseeing freewill offerings and distribution
He was a musician only
He did not serve in the house of the LORD
He was responsible for building altars
questions.correctAnswer: He was the porter overseeing freewill offerings and distribution
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:14 identifies Kore as the porter in charge of freewill offerings and the most holy things, showing the importance of faithful stewardship and service in all roles.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The priests and Levites gave portions to their brethren by courses, both to the great and to the ___.
options: small
young
old
rich
questions.correctAnswer: small
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:15 teaches that provision was distributed fairly to all, both great and small, illustrating humility, equity, and care within the community.

questions.question: What does the detailed attention to genealogy and daily portions for priests and Levites teach about faithfulness and order?
options: It reflects meticulous faithfulness and respect for God’s appointed service
It shows neglect of family lines
It encourages favoritism
It disregards daily needs
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects meticulous faithfulness and respect for God’s appointed service
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:16-17 shows careful record keeping and provision according to genealogy and service, which teaches discipline and respect for God’s order.

questions.question: True or False: Hezekiah’s actions throughout Judah were considered good, right, and true before the LORD.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:20 affirms that Hezekiah did what was good, right, and true before God, serving as a model for godly leadership and obedience.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah approach his service to God according to 2 Chronicles 31?
options: With all his heart, seeking God and prospering
Half-heartedly and without faith
By ignoring the law and commandments
Only when convenient
questions.correctAnswer: With all his heart, seeking God and prospering
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:21 states Hezekiah did all his work with wholehearted devotion to God’s law and commandments, teaching persistence, zeal, and sincerity in service.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 31.

questions.question: What significant religious reform did all Israel carry out according to 2 Chronicles 31:1?
options: They broke the images, cut down groves, and destroyed high places and altars throughout Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh
They built new altars and erected groves in all cities
They gathered for a great festival to honor foreign gods
They sent offerings to the temple in Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: They broke the images, cut down groves, and destroyed high places and altars throughout Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:1 describes how all Israel broke the images in pieces, cut down groves, and threw down the high places and altars throughout Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh as part of religious reform.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah organize the priests and Levites for their service according to this chapter?
options: He appointed their courses according to their service for burnt offerings and peace offerings
He allowed them to serve whenever they wished without order
He assigned them to military duties instead of temple service
He sent them to other nations to spread the law
questions.correctAnswer: He appointed their courses according to their service for burnt offerings and peace offerings
questions.explanation: Verse 2 states that Hezekiah appointed the courses of the priests and Levites after their courses according to their service, specifically for burnt offerings and peace offerings.

questions.question: What does the allocation of the king’s portion in 2 Chronicles 31:3 signify in the context of the Mosaic Law?
options: It reflects adherence to the law specifying offerings for sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts
It was a new institution created by Hezekiah without precedent
It was an optional royal gift unrelated to religious requirements
It represented tribute paid to foreign powers
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects adherence to the law specifying offerings for sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows that Hezekiah appointed the king’s portion for burnt offerings at specified times as written in the law of the LORD, reflecting obedience to Mosaic Law.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 31:5, what was the people's response when commanded to give portions to the priests and Levites?
options: They brought in abundance the firstfruits and tithes of all things
They hesitated and gave reluctantly
They refused to give anything
They only gave after a year of delay
questions.correctAnswer: They brought in abundance the firstfruits and tithes of all things
questions.explanation: Verse 5 records that as soon as the commandment went out, the children of Israel brought abundant firstfruits and tithes, showing wholehearted obedience.

questions.question: What is the significance of the heaps mentioned in 2 Chronicles 31:6-7 in the ancient Israelite religious context?
options: They were large collections of tithes and offerings stored for temple use
They were piles of stones marking battle victories
They were altars for foreign gods
They were burial mounds for priests
questions.correctAnswer: They were large collections of tithes and offerings stored for temple use
questions.explanation: Verses 6 and 7 describe heaps as heaps of tithes and holy things consecrated to the LORD, laid by heaps and founded in the third to seventh months, indicating storage of offerings.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah and the princes react upon seeing the heaps of offerings, and what does this reveal about their leadership?
options: They blessed the LORD and His people Israel, showing their gratitude and piety
They were displeased and demanded the heaps be removed
They ignored the heaps and focused on other matters
They used the heaps for personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: They blessed the LORD and His people Israel, showing their gratitude and piety
questions.explanation: Verse 8 records that Hezekiah and the princes blessed the LORD and His people when they saw the heaps, revealing their leadership rooted in faith and thanksgiving.

questions.question: Who answered Hezekiah’s inquiry about the heaps, and what was the essence of his response in 2 Chronicles 31:10?
options: Azariah the chief priest said they had enough to eat and still had plenty because the LORD blessed His people
A foreign official complained about the heaps
A Levite said the heaps were insufficient for needs
No one answered Hezekiah
questions.correctAnswer: Azariah the chief priest said they had enough to eat and still had plenty because the LORD blessed His people
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states that Azariah, chief priest of the house of Zadok, responded that since offerings began, they had plenty to eat and a great store left, attributing it to the LORD’s blessing.

questions.question: What administrative measures did Hezekiah take to manage the offerings and tithes according to this chapter?
options: He prepared chambers in the house of the LORD and appointed rulers and overseers for the offerings
He left the management to the priests without oversight
He sent the offerings to other kingdoms
He sold the offerings to fund the army
questions.correctAnswer: He prepared chambers in the house of the LORD and appointed rulers and overseers for the offerings
questions.explanation: Verses 11-13 describe Hezekiah commanding the preparation of chambers and appointing Cononiah, Shimei, and other overseers to faithfully manage offerings and tithes.

questions.question: What role did Kore the son of Imnah have in the temple service as described in 2 Chronicles 31:14?
options: He was the porter toward the east, overseeing freewill offerings and distribution of holy things
He was a scribe recording genealogies
He was a military leader protecting the temple
He was a musician playing for the offerings
questions.correctAnswer: He was the porter toward the east, overseeing freewill offerings and distribution of holy things
questions.explanation: Verse 14 explicitly states Kore was the porter to the east and responsible for distributing freewill offerings and most holy things.

questions.question: How does the detailed genealogy and daily portion allocation described in verses 15-18 reflect the ancient Israelite emphasis on religious order and holiness?
options: It demonstrates the strict organization and sanctification of priests, Levites, and their families in their service
It indicates a lax approach to temple duties with no clear roles
It shows a focus on military rather than religious duties
It reveals that genealogies were ignored in favor of popular appointments
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates the strict organization and sanctification of priests, Levites, and their families in their service
questions.explanation: Verses 15-18 detail genealogies and daily portions for priests, Levites, and their families, underscoring the importance of holiness and order in temple service.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'wrought that which was good and right and truth before the LORD' in 2 Chronicles 31:20 suggest about Hezekiah’s reign?
options: Hezekiah’s reforms were characterized by righteousness and faithfulness to God
He was indifferent to religious matters
He led Israel into idolatry
He focused solely on political power
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah’s reforms were characterized by righteousness and faithfulness to God
questions.explanation: Verse 20 describes Hezekiah’s actions as good, right, and true before God, indicating his sincere religious reform and leadership.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 31:21, how did Hezekiah approach his service to God and the house of God?
options: With all his heart, seeking God and prospering in all his works
Reluctantly and with half-hearted effort
By delegating all responsibilities to others
By focusing only on political alliances
questions.correctAnswer: With all his heart, seeking God and prospering in all his works
questions.explanation: Verse 21 states Hezekiah did every work in the house of God and law with all his heart, seeking God and prospering, reflecting wholehearted devotion.

questions.question: True or False: The priests and Levites in 2 Chronicles 31 were given portions based on genealogies and served only from age three upwards.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 16 specifies that from three years old and upward, males were given daily portions for service according to their genealogies, indicating early age involvement.

questions.question: Which priestly family is mentioned as providing leadership and blessing in 2 Chronicles 31, and what is their historical significance?
options: The house of Zadok, known for their exclusive priestly service during the Davidic monarchy
The family of Eli, known for their decline in priesthood
The descendants of Aaron who served only in exile
The family of Levi who rejected temple service
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Zadok, known for their exclusive priestly service during the Davidic monarchy
questions.explanation: Azariah, the chief priest from the house of Zadok, answers Hezekiah in verse 10; Zadok’s family historically held exclusive priestly rights during David’s reign and beyond.

questions.question: How does the reform of destroying images and high places in 2 Chronicles 31:1 connect with earlier biblical reforms found in Deuteronomy?
options: It echoes Deuteronomy's commands to destroy places of idolatry and worship only at the central sanctuary
It contradicts Deuteronomy by allowing local shrines
It is unrelated to Deuteronomy and unique to Chronicles
It promotes syncretism with foreign gods
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes Deuteronomy's commands to destroy places of idolatry and worship only at the central sanctuary
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 12 commands the destruction of high places and centralized worship at the place God chooses; Hezekiah’s reforms in 2 Chronicles 31:1 reflect this principle.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the first action taken by Israel after Hezekiah's reforms were finished?
options: They broke the images and cut down the groves
They built new altars for the LORD
They gathered to celebrate the feast of tabernacles
They appointed new priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: They broke the images and cut down the groves
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:1 states that Israel broke the images in pieces, cut down the groves, and threw down the high places and altars as part of purifying their worship. This signifies a rejection of idolatry consistent with Deuteronomy 12:2-3 and is echoed in prophetic calls such as Jeremiah 10:3-4 and Acts 17:29, emphasizing exclusive worship of the true God.

questions.question: How did Hezekiah organize the priests and Levites in their service?
options: According to their courses and service
By their family wealth
Based on their age only
Randomly by lot
questions.correctAnswer: According to their courses and service
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explains that Hezekiah appointed priests and Levites according to their courses and service, reflecting the biblical principle of order in worship (1 Chronicles 24:1-19). This orderly ministry foreshadows the New Testament emphasis on orderly worship (1 Corinthians 14:40) and faithful stewardship (1 Peter 4:10).

questions.question: What did Hezekiah provide from his own substance for the burnt offerings?
options: The king's portion for morning, evening, sabbaths, new moons, and feasts
Only for the Sabbath burnt offering
For special offerings only
No portion was provided by the king
questions.correctAnswer: The king's portion for morning, evening, sabbaths, new moons, and feasts
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 31:3, Hezekiah gave from his substance for regular burnt offerings, reflecting a king’s role as a mediator and provider for true worship (Exodus 29:38-42). This prefigures Christ as our High Priest who offers continual intercession (Hebrews 7:23-25).

questions.question: What was commanded of the people living in Jerusalem to support the priests and Levites?
options: To give portions to encourage them in the law of the LORD
To build homes for the priests
To offer sacrifices themselves
To fast on behalf of the priests
questions.correctAnswer: To give portions to encourage them in the law of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 4 commands the people to give portions to the priests and Levites to encourage them in the law, emphasizing the importance of supporting those who serve God’s word (Numbers 18:21-24). This principle is echoed in Luke 10:7 and 1 Timothy 5:17-18 regarding support for ministers.

questions.question: What was the response of the children of Israel to the commandment to bring offerings?
options: They brought in abundance the firstfruits and tithe
They refused to give offerings
They brought only a small amount
They delayed bringing offerings
questions.correctAnswer: They brought in abundance the firstfruits and tithe
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:5 shows Israel bringing abundant firstfruits and tithes, signaling joyful obedience and recognition of God's provision (Proverbs 3:9, Malachi 3:10). This aligns with New Testament teaching on generous giving (2 Corinthians 9:6-7).

questions.question: What types of tithes did the people in the cities of Judah bring?
options: Tithe of oxen, sheep, and holy things consecrated to the LORD
Only grain and wine
Silver and gold
No tithes were brought
questions.correctAnswer: Tithe of oxen, sheep, and holy things consecrated to the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that the tithes included oxen, sheep, and holy things consecrated to God, reflecting Levitical requirements for offerings (Leviticus 27:30-33). This underscores God's claim over all creation and the call to holiness (Romans 12:1).

questions.question: How long did it take from the beginning to the completion of laying the foundation of the heaps of offerings?
options: From the third month to the seventh month
One month
One year
One week
questions.correctAnswer: From the third month to the seventh month
questions.explanation: Verse 7 describes the heaps being laid from the third to the seventh month, showing sustained faithfulness in giving. This patient and consistent obedience prefigures the perseverance required in the Christian life (Hebrews 10:36).

questions.question: What was Hezekiah and the princes' reaction upon seeing the heaps of offerings?
options: They blessed the LORD and His people Israel
They were worried about storage
They doubted the people's sincerity
They ignored the heaps
questions.correctAnswer: They blessed the LORD and His people Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 31:8 shows that Hezekiah and the princes blessed the LORD and His people, recognizing God's blessing in the abundance. This reflects gratitude and worship, consistent with Psalm 103:2 and Philippians 4:6.

questions.question: What did Azariah the chief priest say about the offerings brought by the people?
options: They had enough to eat and left plenty because the LORD blessed His people
They were insufficient for the priests' needs
They were rejected due to impurity
They were being hoarded selfishly
questions.correctAnswer: They had enough to eat and left plenty because the LORD blessed His people
questions.explanation: Verse 10 records Azariah affirming God's blessing through abundant offerings. This highlights divine provision and faithful stewardship, paralleling 2 Corinthians 9:8 and Psalm 65:9-13.

questions.question: Who was appointed to oversee the offerings and tithes brought into the house of the LORD?
options: Cononiah the Levite and his brother Shimei
King Hezekiah alone
Azariah the chief priest only
The elders of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Cononiah the Levite and his brother Shimei
questions.explanation: Verse 12 specifies Cononiah and Shimei as rulers over the offerings, indicating organized stewardship. This is consistent with biblical principles of orderly ministry (1 Corinthians 12:28) and accountability (Hebrews 13:17).

questions.question: What role did Kore the son of Imnah the Levite have?
options: Over the freewill offerings to distribute the oblations and most holy things
High priest of Israel
Commander of the army
Scribe of the law
questions.correctAnswer: Over the freewill offerings to distribute the oblations and most holy things
questions.explanation: Verse 14 notes Kore's responsibility over freewill offerings and holy things, emphasizing proper handling of sacred donations, reflecting the sanctity of worship (Leviticus 10:8-11) and stewardship (Luke 12:42-44).

questions.question: How were the portions distributed among the priests in the cities?
options: By courses and set offices, giving to great and small alike
Only to the priests from Jerusalem
Based on personal merit
By random selection
questions.correctAnswer: By courses and set offices, giving to great and small alike
questions.explanation: Verse 15 describes distribution according to set offices and courses, ensuring equitable provision. This reflects God's justice and order (Deuteronomy 18:1-5), aligning with New Testament fairness in ministry support (Galatians 6:6).

questions.question: From what age were males accounted for their daily portion in the service of the house of the LORD?
options: From three years old and upward
From birth
From twenty years old
From ten years old
questions.correctAnswer: From three years old and upward
questions.explanation: Verse 16 indicates males from three years old were included, illustrating early dedication and family involvement in covenant worship (Exodus 13:2, Luke 2:22-24). This highlights God's call on believers to serve from a young age.

questions.question: What is said about the sanctification of the priests, Levites, and their families?
options: They sanctified themselves in holiness in their set office
They were not required to be holy
Only the priests were holy, not their families
Sanctification was optional
questions.correctAnswer: They sanctified themselves in holiness in their set office
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states they sanctified themselves in holiness, reflecting God's call to holiness for His people (Leviticus 20:7, 1 Peter 1:15-16). This sanctification is vital for worship and service to God.

questions.question: What summary is given about Hezekiah's actions throughout Judah?
options: He wrought that which was good, right, and true before the LORD his God
He was indifferent to the law
He rebelled against the LORD
He neglected the priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: He wrought that which was good, right, and true before the LORD his God
questions.explanation: Verse 20 praises Hezekiah's conduct as good, right, and true, highlighting faithful leadership in covenant obedience (Psalm 78:72, Proverbs 29:2). His heart aligns with God's righteousness (Matthew 5:8).
